Episodes.Title: Gavin and Stacey
Episodes.Plot: After being phone buddies for months, Gavin and Stacey finally arrange a rendezvous in Leicester Square, with Stacey's best friend Nessa and Gav's pal Smithy coming along for support.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Sex scenes and offensive language

Episodes.Title: The Phone Call
Episodes.Plot: After a huge misunderstanding on the phone, Stacey thinks Gavin has finished with her. He drives to Wales to explain and ends up taking her home with him. Having never been further than Bridgend before, Stacey's trip to Essex is an eye-opening experience that ends with the biggest surprise of all.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Sex scenes and offensive language

Episodes.Title: Engagement Party
Episodes.Plot: After his initial angry reaction to Stacey's news, Uncle Bryn agrees to drive them all to Essex to meet the Shipmans. Pam has laid on a cracking spread and the party goes with a bang. But then Gavin and Stacey make an announcement that throws all the bonhomie out the window.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Sex scenes and offensive language

Episodes.Title: The Big Secret
Episodes.Plot: The Shipmans drive down to Wales for the wedding fayre. After an eventful trip to church to hear the banns being read, Nessa confides in Stacey her big secret.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Sex scenes and offensive language
Episodes.GuestStars: Gillian Elisa, William Thomas, Margaret John

Episodes.Title: Hen Night for Stacey
Episodes.Plot: Stacey's brother Jason arrives home early, much to Uncle Bryn's horror. Stacey has her hen night and Gavin has two stag nights, the second of which reveals something about Stacey that could jeopardise the whole wedding.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Sex scenes and offensive language

Episodes.Title: The Big Day
Episodes.Plot: The wedding day has finally arrived, but will they go through with it? Will Uncle Bryn finally admit to what happened on the fishing trip and will Nessa do what she knows she must?
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Sex scenes and offensive language
